meanings.definition: A person who works in a coal mine.
meanings.sent1: The coalier descended into the dark mine to extract coal.
meanings.sent2: The coalier's job involves digging for coal deep underground.
meanings.sent3: The coalier told a joke about finding diamonds instead of coal in the mine.
meanings.sent4: Her hands, blackened like a coalier's, worked tirelessly to unearth the precious mineral.
meanings.sent5: The coalier's face was streaked with coal dust after a long day's work.

meanings.sent1: The coalier sky at dusk reminded him of the color of coal.
meanings.sent2: The coalier rocks along the riverbank had a dark, shiny appearance.
meanings.sent3: The coalier paint on the old house gave it a unique charm.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, black and glossy, had a coalier sheen in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The coalier clouds in the sky signaled an impending storm.

meanings.sent1: His hands were coalier after fixing the furnace in the basement.
meanings.sent2: The coalier face of the miner showed the hard day's work he had done.
meanings.sent3: The cat came home with a coalier fur than usual after exploring the old mine.
meanings.sent4: The coalier footprints on the floor led to the culprit who had been playing with coal.
meanings.sent5: The coalier clothes of the workers indicated they had been busy in the coal mine.
